casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Andre K. FOUNTAIN, also known as Dre Fountain, Defendant-Appellant. No. 09-31020

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. April 19, 2011. Edward John Rivera, Esq., Assistant U.S. Attorney, Diane Hollenshead Copes, Esq., Assistant U.S. Attorney, Stephen Andrew Higginson, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, New Orleans, LA, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Frank Sloan, Mandeville, LA, for Defendant-Appellant. Andre K. Fountain, Yazoo City, MS, pro se. Before JOLLY, OWEN, and HAYNES, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Andre K. Fountain has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967), and United States v. Flores, 632 F.3d 229 (5th Cir.2011). Fountain has not filed a response. We have reviewed counsel’s *378brief and the relevant portions of the record reflected therein. We concur with counsel’s assessment that the appeal presents no nonfrivolous issue for appellate review. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except tinder the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
